meta.title: Saturn vs Cronitor: Anomaly Detection & Kubernetes Native | Saturn
meta.description: Feature comparison: Saturn adds statistical anomaly detection, health scoring, native Kubernetes support, and WordPress plugin that Cronitor lacks.

hero.headline: Saturn vs Cronitor
hero.subheadline: Next-generation monitoring with anomaly detection and Kubernetes-native tools

differences.title: Statistical Anomaly Detection
differences.saturn: Uses Welford's algorithm for incremental statistics. Detects when jobs run 3+ standard deviations slower than baseline, even if they technically succeed.
differences.cronitor: Binary pass/fail only. No performance anomaly detection. You won't know if a job slows from 10s to 50s until it times out completely.

differences.title: Health Scoring System
differences.saturn: Every monitor gets a 0-100 health score with A-F grade based on uptime, incidents, and consistency. Perfect for executive dashboards and SLA reporting.
differences.cronitor: No health scoring. Only status indicators (up/down).

differences.title: Kubernetes Native
differences.saturn: Helm chart with Go sidecar. Deploy monitoring in 60 seconds with zero code changes to your CronJob manifests.
differences.cronitor: Manual integration required. Must modify every container to add curl/ping logic.

differences.title: WordPress at Scale
differences.saturn: Dedicated plugin for wp-cron monitoring. Perfect for agencies managing 100+ sites with bulk deployment and centralized dashboards.
differences.cronitor: Generic HTTP integration. No WordPress-specific features or bulk management.

faq.question: Can I import my Cronitor monitors?
faq.answer: We don't have a direct import tool, but the Saturn CLI makes it easy to bulk-create monitors from a CSV or JSON file. Contact support@saturn.example.com for migration assistance.

faq.question: Does Saturn have a PagerDuty integration?
faq.answer: Not yet (coming in Q1 2026), but you can use webhooks to integrate with PagerDuty's Events API today.

faq.question: Will I save money switching to Saturn?
faq.answer: Depends on usage. Saturn offers more monitors per tier (50 vs 30 at $29/mo) and a larger free tier (10 vs 3). Plus you get anomaly detection included.

faq.question: What if I'm already using Cronitor's RUM or status pages?
faq.answer: Saturn focuses exclusively on cron/job monitoring. If you need RUM or status pages, you may want to keep Cronitor for those features.
